newsitem.title: USA: US Midwest hogs called lower for Monday - trade.
newsitem.headline: US Midwest hogs called lower for Monday - trade.

text.p: U.S. Midwest direct cash hogs were called about $0.50 per cwt lower Monday because of continued weakness in cash pork prices, cash dealers said.

A few hog plants will be closed Monday in observance of the U.S. President's Day holiday, but most of the price pressure will be because of the lower pork prices and negative packer operating margins, dealers said.
Hog marketings were light to moderate Friday with some packers able to buy enough Friday to satisfy a portion of Monday's slaughter.
Interior Iowa and southern Minnesota sources expect hogs to trade from $50.00 to $51.00 per cwt at country points Monday versus $51.50 to $52.00 tops Friday.
Meat packers have scaled slaughter, with Friday's slaughter estimated by USDA at 325,000 head versus 349,000 a week ago. Saturday's slaughter was estimated at 53,000 head versus 55,000 a week ago.
